data.name: Wonder Boy: The Dragon's Trap - Original Soundtrack
data.detailed_description:
The Original Soundtrack of Wonder Boy: The Dragon's Trap.


A 89 tracks album to celebrate the best game to come out of 1989 - All the classic, infinitely hummable themes from Shinichi Sakamoto re-imagined and exquisitely re-orchestrated as a labor of love by master composer Michael Geyre. A thoroughly enjoyable soundtrack that stands on its own as a must have album made by fans, for fans.

The 33 main tracks total over an hour of high quality music featuring live performers across a wide variety of styles and instruments.

The 56 bonus tracks offer surprising insight into the composition and arrangement process by including an exclusive extra hour of alternate versions, sketches, unused and or sometimes rejected material.

FORMAT


MP3 320 KBPS + FLAC Lossless, both DRM-free.

TRACK LISTING

Music by: Michael Geyre
Based on original work by: Shinichi Sakamoto
Additional Arrangements by: Romain Gauthier

Direction, Arrangements, Programming, Accordion, Piano, Synthesizers: Michael Geyre
Alto: Marie-Laure Prioleau
Bandoneon: Patrick Brugalières
Bansuri Flute: Émilie Calmé
Cello: Emmanuelle Faure
Clarinet: Eric Moncoucout
Double Bass: Mathieu Sternat
Drums: Ersoj Kazimov
Guitar: Loïc le Guillanton
Mandolin, Violin: Camille Raibaud
Oboe: Eric Cassen
Oud: Ziad Ben Youssef
Tenor Sax: Ernest W Hillard
Trumpet, Cornet, Trombone: Michael W Hillard
Violin: Yann Brébia, Jean-Christophe Morel
Whistle: Arnaud Bibone
Additional Arrangements, Programming: Romain Gauthier
Additional Drums: Gaétan Diaz
Additional Violin: Adèle Docherty
Recording: Pierre Delmas, Olivier Grall
Mixing, Mastering: Olivier Grall
Bonus Track 88 by: Kenneth C M Young

Recorded at Studio Patrick Brugalières, France.

data.short_description: All the classic, infinitely hummable Wonder Boy: The Dragon’s Trap themes from Shinichi Sakamoto re-imagined and exquisitely re-orchestrated as a labor of love by master composer Michael Geyre. A thoroughly enjoyable soundtrack that stands on its own as a must have album made by fans, for fans.
data.supported_languages:
English*, French
*languages with full audio support
data.reviews:
“One of the best musical adaptations in recent memory.”
IGN US

“Shinichi Sakamoto's 8-bit soundtrack was reimagined and recorded with live instruments, and it's all extremely catchy. I caught myself humming the town theme tune in the shower days after I finished the game.”
DESTRUCTOID

“It's all very retro and very fun and, for me at least, not just nostalgic but sort of joyful, like seeing an old friend again after many years.”
FORBES
